In Singapore, the agencies involved in hearing research include National University of Singapore (NUS), Duke-NUS Medical School, National University Health System (NUHS), Singapore General Hospital (SGH), and KK Women's and Children's Hospital (KKH). These agencies conduct a wide range of research on various aspects of hearing and hearing disorders, including but not limited to:

1. Hearing loss, tinnitus, and balance disorders
2. Cochlear implantation and hearing aids
3. Speech and language development in children with hearing loss
4. Ototoxicity and its impact on hearing
5. Development and testing of new hearing technologies
6. Genetics and epigenetics of hearing loss
7. Age-related hearing loss
8. Noise-induced hearing loss

These agencies often collaborate with international partners and use advanced technologies, such as functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) and electroencephalography (EEG), to conduct their research. The goal of their research is to advance the understanding of hearing and hearing disorders and to develop new treatments and technologies to improve hearing health.
